intro: Ruta punctata, commonly known as spotted rue, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from spring to summer. The plant has aromatic, dark green leaves with distinctive white or yellow spots, which are characteristic of the genus Ruta. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often growing in rocky or dry habitats. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
